review: I have in my possession two other devices which performs similar as the Amazon fire but Amazon fire to me succeeds  over the other two. They're all very easy to set-up but one very important feature that the Amazon fire has the others don't and I'm very very happy with it is the fabulously easy way to use the search feature. Most people like myself finds it very tedious to punch in letters up down sideways crossways and don't make a mistake, No No Not That!!  But with the Amazon fire remote you only have to use a button and speak into it and it finds whatever you need quickly and efficiently. And to me that's everything not only that I must mention the Amazon fire is quick very fast! This is why I give it five stars!

review: I have been looking for a device which would give me the ability to reduce my cable company to the most basic level of service or to eliminate it completely. As I am using Amazon Fire TV I am becoming more familiar with what is available as a user of the device, what is available as an Amazon Prime member and what would add unexpected costs. It would be useful if there was a guide which clearly covered the things which are free and which cost as well as give a clear understanding of whether an app is really useful or is redundant in some other app function.

review: I bought a Roku last year and I did like it but found I mostly used it to watch Amazon Streaming.  So when Amazon Fire TV came out I purchased it at the first opportunity.  I am not disappointed at all,  I even ordered a game controller in less then a week after purchasing the Fire TV Box.  The Search is great and I have tried to confuse it and so far it has about 98% accuracy. The movies stream quickly and look good.Now for the improvements.  I have not downloaded 14 apps, this includes music, news and game apps and currently I have 1.93GB left but the fire is constantly hounding me to remove apps because memory is getting low.  There should be either a way to add additional storage either through the USB port or add a SD Port and allow for an SD Card for added storage.In addition Movies and shows available through Prime should be easier to scroll through, perhaps by adding a Prime area that shows only whats available on Prime and then allow the user to break that down for example I want to find a SCIFI Movie on Prime I should be able to see what is available.Overall the Amazon Fire is outstanding and I cant wait to see what comes next.
